<P style="margin:0px"><BR></P>
<P style="margin:0px; font-family:'Courier New'" align=center><B>SECTION 1350 CERTIFICATION</B></P>
<P style="margin:0px"><BR></P>
<P style="margin:0px; font-family:'Courier New'" align=justify>In connection with the Annual Report of <U>International Barrier Technology Inc.</U> (the &#147;Company&#148;) on Form 10-K for the Fiscal Year ended <U>June 30,2015</U> as filed with the Securities and Exchange Commission on the date hereof (the &#147;Report&#148;), I, <U>Michael Huddy</U>, Chief Executive Officer of the Company, certify, pursuant to Section 1350 of Chapter 63 of Title 18 of the United States Code, as adopted pursuant to Section 906 of the Sarbanes Oxley Act of 2002, that to the best of my knowledge:</P>
<P style="margin:0px" align=justify><BR></P>
<P style="margin-top:0px; margin-bottom:-2px; width:28.8px; font-family:'Courier New'; float:left">1.</P>
<P style="margin:0px; padding-left:28.8px; text-indent:-2px; font-family:'Courier New'" align=justify>The Report fully complies with the requirements of Section 13(a) of the Securities Exchange Act of 1934; and</P>
<P style="margin-top:0px; margin-bottom:-2px; width:28.8px; font-family:'Courier New'; clear:left; float:left">2.</P>
<P style="margin:0px; padding-left:28.8px; text-indent:-2px; font-family:'Courier New'" align=justify>The information contained in the Report fairly presents, in all material respects, the financial condition and results of operations of the Company.</P>
<P style="margin:0px; clear:left"><BR></P>
<P style="margin:0px; font-family:'Courier New'">Date: September 28, 2015</P>
<P style="margin:0px"><BR></P>
<P style="margin:0px; font-family:'Courier New'"><U>/s/ Michael Huddy</U></P>

<P style="margin:0px; font-family:'Courier New'">(Principal Executive Officer)</P>

<P style="margin:0px"><BR></P>

	<us-gaap:OrganizationConsolidationAndPresentationOfFinancialStatementsDisclosureTextBlock contextRef='D140701_150630'>&lt;!--egx--&gt;&lt;p style=&apos;margin:0pt;margin-bottom:.0001pt&apos;&gt;Note 1&amp;#160;&amp;#160;&amp;#160;&amp;#160;&amp;#160;&amp;#160;&amp;#160; &lt;u&gt;Nature of Operations&lt;/u&gt;&lt;/p&gt; &lt;p style=&apos;margin:0pt;margin-bottom:.0001pt&apos;&gt;&amp;nbsp;&lt;/p&gt; &lt;p style=&apos;margin:0pt;margin-bottom:.0001pt&apos;&gt;The Company develops and manufactures proprietary fire resistant building materials in the United States of America and, as well, the Company owns the exclusive U.S. and international rights to the Pyrotite fire retardant technology. All of the Company&amp;#146;s revenues and substantially all of the long-term assets are located in the United States. There are minimal long-term assets held in Canada.&lt;/p&gt; &lt;p style=&apos;margin:0pt;margin-bottom:.0001pt&apos;&gt;&amp;nbsp;&lt;/p&gt; &lt;p style=&apos;margin:0pt;margin-bottom:.0001pt&apos;&gt;The Company was incorporated under the British Columbia Company Act and is publicly traded on the TSX Venture Exchange in Canada (&amp;#147;TSX-V&amp;#148;) and the OTC Bulletin Board in the United States of America.&amp;#160; &lt;/p&gt; &lt;p style=&apos;margin:0pt;margin-bottom:.0001pt&apos;&gt;&amp;nbsp;&lt;/p&gt;</us-gaap:OrganizationConsolidationAndPresentationOfFinancialStatementsDisclosureTextBlock>	<us-gaap:SignificantAccountingPoliciesTextBlock contextRef='D140701_150630'>&lt;!--egx--&gt;&lt;p style=&apos;margin:0pt;margin-bottom:.0001pt&apos;&gt;Note 2&amp;#160;&amp;#160;&amp;#160;&amp;#160;&amp;#160;&amp;#160;&amp;#160; &lt;u&gt;Significant Accounting Policies&lt;/u&gt;&lt;/p&gt; &lt;p style=&apos;margin:0pt;margin-bottom:.0001pt&apos;&gt;&amp;nbsp;&lt;/p&gt; &lt;p style=&apos;margin:0pt;margin-bottom:.0001pt&apos;&gt;The preparation of financial statements in accordance with United States generally accepted accounting principles requires management to make estimates and assumptions that affect the reported amounts of assets and liabilities at the date of the financial statements and the reported amounts of revenue and expenses in the reporting period. The Company regularly evaluates estimates and assumptions related to deferred income tax asset valuations, asset impairment, derivative liability, stock based compensation and loss contingencies. The Company bases its estimates and assumptions on current facts, historical experience and various other factors that it believes to be reasonable under the circumstances, the results of which form the basis for making judgments about the carrying values of assets and liabilities and the accrual of costs and expenses that are not readily apparent from other sources. The actual results experienced by the Company may differ materially and adversely from the Company&amp;#146;s estimates. To the extent there are material differences between the estimates and the actual results, future results of operations will be affected.&lt;/p&gt; &lt;p style=&apos;margin:0pt;margin-bottom:.0001pt&apos;&gt;&amp;nbsp;&lt;/p&gt; &lt;p style=&apos;margin:0pt;margin-bottom:.0001pt&apos;&gt;The financial statements have, in management&amp;#146;s opinion, been properly prepared within the framework of the significant accounting policies summarized below:&lt;/p&gt; &lt;p style=&apos;margin:0pt;margin-bottom:.0001pt&apos;&gt;&amp;nbsp;&lt;/p&gt; &lt;p style=&apos;margin:0pt;margin-bottom:.0001pt&apos;&gt;a)&amp;#160;&amp;#160;&amp;#160;&amp;#160;&amp;#160;&amp;#160;&amp;#160;&amp;#160; &lt;u&gt;Principles of Consolidation&lt;/u&gt;&lt;/p&gt; &lt;p style=&apos;margin:0pt;margin-bottom:.0001pt&apos;&gt;&amp;nbsp;&lt;/p&gt; &lt;p style=&apos;margin:0pt;margin-bottom:.0001pt&apos;&gt;These consolidated financial statements include the accounts of International Barrier Technology Inc. and its wholly-owned subsidiaries, Pyrotite Coatings of Canada Inc., a Canadian company and Barrier Technology Corporation (&amp;#147;Barrier&amp;#148;), a US company.&amp;#160; All inter-company transactions and balances have been eliminated.&lt;/p&gt; &lt;p style=&apos;margin:0pt;margin-bottom:.0001pt&apos;&gt;&amp;nbsp;&lt;/p&gt; &lt;p style=&apos;margin:0pt;margin-bottom:.0001pt&apos;&gt;&amp;nbsp;&lt;/p&gt; &lt;p style=&apos;margin:0pt;margin-bottom:.0001pt&apos;&gt;b)&amp;#160;&amp;#160;&amp;#160;&amp;#160;&amp;#160;&amp;#160;&amp;#160;&amp;#160; &lt;u&gt;Cash and Cash Equivalents&lt;/u&gt;&lt;/p&gt; &lt;p style=&apos;margin:0pt;margin-bottom:.0001pt&apos;&gt;&amp;nbsp;&lt;/p&gt; &lt;p style=&apos;margin:0pt;margin-bottom:.0001pt&apos;&gt;The Company considers highly liquid investments with insignificant interest rate risk and an original maturity of three months or less on the purchase date to be cash equivalents.&lt;/p&gt; &lt;p style=&apos;margin:0pt;margin-bottom:.0001pt&apos;&gt;&amp;nbsp;&lt;/p&gt; &lt;p style=&apos;margin:0pt;margin-bottom:.0001pt&apos;&gt;&amp;nbsp;&lt;/p&gt; &lt;p style=&apos;margin:0pt;margin-bottom:.0001pt&apos;&gt;c)&amp;#160;&amp;#160;&amp;#160;&amp;#160;&amp;#160;&amp;#160;&amp;#160;&amp;#160; &lt;u&gt;Inventory&lt;/u&gt;&lt;/p&gt; &lt;p style=&apos;margin:0pt;margin-bottom:.0001pt&apos;&gt;&amp;nbsp;&lt;/p&gt; &lt;p style=&apos;margin:0pt;margin-bottom:.0001pt&apos;&gt;Inventory is valued by management at the lower of cost on a FIFO (first-in, first-out) and net realizable value. Net realizable value is the estimated selling price less any additional cost of sale. &amp;#160;&amp;#160;In addition, items such as abnormal amounts of idle facility expense, freight, handling and waste material are recognized as current period charges rather than inventory value.&amp;#160; &lt;/p&gt; &lt;p style=&apos;margin:0pt;margin-bottom:.0001pt&apos;&gt;&amp;nbsp;&lt;/p&gt; &lt;p style=&apos;margin:0pt;margin-bottom:.0001pt&apos;&gt;&amp;nbsp;&lt;/p&gt; &lt;p style=&apos;margin:0pt;margin-bottom:.0001pt&apos;&gt;d)&amp;#160;&amp;#160;&amp;#160;&amp;#160;&amp;#160;&amp;#160;&amp;#160;&amp;#160; &lt;u&gt;Plant and Equipment, Trademark and Technology Rights and Depreciation&lt;/u&gt;&lt;/p&gt; &lt;p style=&apos;margin:0pt;margin-bottom:.0001pt&apos;&gt;&amp;nbsp;&lt;/p&gt; &lt;p style=&apos;margin:0pt;margin-bottom:.0001pt&apos;&gt;Plant and equipment and trademark and technology rights are recorded at cost.&amp;#160; Depreciation is provided as follows:&lt;/p&gt; &lt;p style=&apos;margin:0pt;margin-bottom:.0001pt&apos;&gt;&amp;nbsp;&lt;/p&gt; &lt;p style=&apos;margin:0pt;margin-bottom:.0001pt&apos;&gt;&amp;nbsp;&lt;/p&gt; &lt;table border=&quot;0&quot; cellspacing=&quot;0&quot; cellpadding=&quot;0&quot; style=&apos;border-collapse:collapse&apos;&gt; &lt;tr align=&quot;left&quot;&gt; &lt;td width=&quot;246&quot; valign=&quot;top&quot; style=&apos;width:184.5pt;padding:0pt 5.4pt 0pt 5.4pt&apos;&gt; &lt;p style=&apos;margin:0pt;margin-bottom:.0001pt&apos;&gt;Manufacturing equipment&lt;/p&gt; &lt;/td&gt; &lt;td width=&quot;345&quot; valign=&quot;top&quot; style=&apos;width:258.9pt;padding:0pt 5.4pt 0pt 5.4pt&apos;&gt; &lt;p style=&apos;margin:0pt;margin-bottom:.0001pt&apos;&gt;straight line over estimated useful lives ranging from 5 years to 30 years.&lt;/p&gt; &lt;/td&gt; &lt;/tr&gt; &lt;tr align=&quot;left&quot;&gt; &lt;td width=&quot;246&quot; valign=&quot;top&quot; style=&apos;width:184.5pt;padding:0pt 5.4pt 0pt 5.4pt&apos;&gt; &lt;p style=&apos;margin:0pt;margin-bottom:.0001pt&apos;&gt;Equipment and furniture&lt;/p&gt; &lt;/td&gt; &lt;td width=&quot;345&quot; valign=&quot;top&quot; style=&apos;width:258.9pt;padding:0pt 5.4pt 0pt 5.4pt&apos;&gt; &lt;p style=&apos;margin:0pt;margin-bottom:.0001pt&apos;&gt;20%- declining balance&lt;/p&gt; &lt;/td&gt; &lt;/tr&gt; &lt;tr align=&quot;left&quot;&gt; &lt;td width=&quot;246&quot; valign=&quot;top&quot; style=&apos;width:184.5pt;padding:0pt 5.4pt 0pt 5.4pt&apos;&gt; &lt;p style=&apos;margin:0pt;margin-bottom:.0001pt&apos;&gt;Computer equipment&lt;/p&gt; &lt;/td&gt; &lt;td width=&quot;345&quot; valign=&quot;top&quot; style=&apos;width:258.9pt;padding:0pt 5.4pt 0pt 5.4pt&apos;&gt; &lt;p style=&apos;margin:0pt;margin-bottom:.0001pt&apos;&gt;30% - declining balance&lt;/p&gt; &lt;/td&gt; &lt;/tr&gt; &lt;tr align=&quot;left&quot;&gt; &lt;td width=&quot;246&quot; valign=&quot;top&quot; style=&apos;width:184.5pt;padding:0pt 5.4pt 0pt 5.4pt&apos;&gt; &lt;p style=&apos;margin:0pt;margin-bottom:.0001pt&apos;&gt;Railway spur&lt;/p&gt; &lt;/td&gt; &lt;td width=&quot;345&quot; valign=&quot;top&quot; style=&apos;width:258.9pt;padding:0pt 5.4pt 0pt 5.4pt&apos;&gt; &lt;p style=&apos;margin:0pt;margin-bottom:.0001pt&apos;&gt;4% - declining balance&lt;/p&gt; &lt;/td&gt; &lt;/tr&gt; &lt;tr align=&quot;left&quot;&gt; &lt;td width=&quot;246&quot; valign=&quot;top&quot; style=&apos;width:184.5pt;padding:0pt 5.4pt 0pt 5.4pt&apos;&gt; &lt;p style=&apos;margin:0pt;margin-bottom:.0001pt&apos;&gt;Equipment under capital lease&lt;/p&gt; &lt;/td&gt; &lt;td width=&quot;345&quot; valign=&quot;top&quot; style=&apos;width:258.9pt;padding:0pt 5.4pt 0pt 5.4pt&apos;&gt; &lt;p style=&apos;margin:0pt;margin-bottom:.0001pt&apos;&gt;20% - declining balance&lt;/p&gt; &lt;/td&gt; &lt;/tr&gt; &lt;tr align=&quot;left&quot;&gt; &lt;td width=&quot;246&quot; valign=&quot;top&quot; style=&apos;width:184.5pt;padding:0pt 5.4pt 0pt 5.4pt&apos;&gt; &lt;p style=&apos;margin:0pt;margin-bottom:.0001pt&apos;&gt;Building under capital lease&lt;/p&gt; &lt;/td&gt; &lt;td width=&quot;345&quot; valign=&quot;top&quot; style=&apos;width:258.9pt;padding:0pt 5.4pt 0pt 5.4pt&apos;&gt; &lt;p style=&apos;margin:0pt;margin-bottom:.0001pt&apos;&gt;straight line over 20 years&lt;/p&gt; &lt;/td&gt; &lt;/tr&gt; &lt;tr align=&quot;left&quot;&gt; &lt;td width=&quot;246&quot; valign=&quot;top&quot; style=&apos;width:184.5pt;padding:0pt 5.4pt 0pt 5.4pt&apos;&gt; &lt;p style=&apos;margin:0pt;margin-bottom:.0001pt&apos;&gt;Patent, trademark and technology rights&lt;/p&gt; &lt;/td&gt; &lt;td width=&quot;345&quot; valign=&quot;top&quot; style=&apos;width:258.9pt;padding:0pt 5.4pt 0pt 5.4pt&apos;&gt; &lt;p style=&apos;margin:0pt;margin-bottom:.0001pt&apos;&gt;straight line over 8 years&lt;/p&gt; &lt;/td&gt; &lt;/tr&gt; &lt;/table&gt; &lt;p style=&apos;margin:0pt;margin-bottom:.0001pt&apos;&gt;&amp;nbsp;&lt;/p&gt; &lt;p style=&apos;margin:0pt;margin-bottom:.0001pt&apos;&gt;&amp;nbsp;&lt;/p&gt; &lt;p style=&apos;margin:0pt;margin-bottom:.0001pt&apos;&gt;Leasehold improvements are depreciated over the shorter of the lease term or the estimated useful economic life. &lt;/p&gt; &lt;p style=&apos;margin:0pt;margin-bottom:.0001pt&apos;&gt;&amp;nbsp;&lt;/p&gt; &lt;p style=&apos;margin:0pt;margin-bottom:.0001pt&apos;&gt;&amp;nbsp;&lt;/p&gt; &lt;p style=&apos;margin:0pt;margin-bottom:.0001pt&apos;&gt;e)&amp;#160;&amp;#160;&amp;#160;&amp;#160;&amp;#160;&amp;#160;&amp;#160;&amp;#160; &lt;u&gt;Impairment of Long-Lived Assets&lt;/u&gt;&lt;/p&gt; &lt;p style=&apos;margin:0pt;margin-bottom:.0001pt&apos;&gt;&amp;nbsp;&lt;/p&gt; &lt;p style=&apos;margin:0pt;margin-bottom:.0001pt&apos;&gt;The Company reviews the recoverability of its long-lived assets whenever events or changes in circumstances indicate that the carrying amount of such assets may not be recoverable. The estimated future cash flows are based upon, among other things, assumptions about future operating performance, and may differ from actual cash flows. Long-lived assets evaluated for impairment are grouped with other assets to the lowest level for which identifiable cash flows are largely independent of the cash flows of other groups of assets and liabilities. If the sum of the projected undiscounted cash flows (excluding interest) is less than the carrying value of the assets, the assets will be written down to the estimated fair value in the period in which the determination is made. &lt;/p&gt; &lt;p style=&apos;margin:0pt;margin-bottom:.0001pt&apos;&gt;&amp;nbsp;&lt;/p&gt; &lt;p style=&apos;margin:0pt;margin-bottom:.0001pt&apos;&gt;&amp;nbsp;&lt;/p&gt; &lt;p style=&apos;margin:0pt;margin-bottom:.0001pt&apos;&gt;f)&amp;#160;&amp;#160;&amp;#160;&amp;#160;&amp;#160;&amp;#160;&amp;#160;&amp;#160;&amp;#160; &lt;u&gt;Leases&lt;/u&gt;&lt;/p&gt; &lt;p style=&apos;margin:0pt;margin-bottom:.0001pt&apos;&gt;&amp;nbsp;&lt;/p&gt; &lt;p style=&apos;margin:0pt;margin-bottom:.0001pt&apos;&gt;Leases are classified as capital or operating leases.&amp;#160; A lease that transfers substantially all benefits and risks incidental to the ownership of property is classified as a capital lease.&amp;#160; At the inception of a capital lease, an asset and an obligation are recorded at an amount equal to the lesser of the present value of the minimum lease payments and the property&amp;#146;s fair value at the beginning of the lease.&amp;#160; All other leases are accounted for as operating leases wherein rental payments are expensed as incurred.&lt;/p&gt; &lt;p style=&apos;margin:0pt;margin-bottom:.0001pt&apos;&gt;&amp;nbsp;&lt;/p&gt; &lt;p style=&apos;margin:0pt;margin-bottom:.0001pt&apos;&gt;&amp;nbsp;&lt;/p&gt; &lt;p style=&apos;margin:0pt;margin-bottom:.0001pt&apos;&gt;g)&amp;#160;&amp;#160;&amp;#160;&amp;#160;&amp;#160;&amp;#160;&amp;#160;&amp;#160; &lt;u&gt;Foreign Currency Translation&lt;/u&gt;&lt;/p&gt; &lt;p style=&apos;margin:0pt;margin-bottom:.0001pt&apos;&gt;&amp;nbsp;&lt;/p&gt; &lt;p style=&apos;margin:0pt;margin-bottom:.0001pt&apos;&gt;The functional currency for the Company&amp;#146;s operations is the U.S. dollar. Monetary assets and liabilities denominated in Canadian dollars are translated into U.S. dollars at the exchange rate prevailing at the end of the year.&amp;#160; Non-monetary assets and liabilities are translated at the exchange rate prevailing at the respective transaction dates while revenues and expenses are translated at the average exchange rate during the year.&amp;#160; Exchange gains and losses are recognized in the statement of operations. &lt;/p&gt; &lt;p style=&apos;margin:0pt;margin-bottom:.0001pt&apos;&gt;&amp;nbsp;&lt;/p&gt; &lt;p style=&apos;margin:0pt;margin-bottom:.0001pt&apos;&gt;&amp;nbsp;&lt;/p&gt; &lt;p style=&apos;margin:0pt;margin-bottom:.0001pt&apos;&gt;h)&amp;#160;&amp;#160;&amp;#160;&amp;#160;&amp;#160;&amp;#160;&amp;#160;&amp;#160; &lt;u&gt;Research and Development Costs&lt;/u&gt;&lt;/p&gt; &lt;p style=&apos;margin:0pt;margin-bottom:.0001pt&apos;&gt;&amp;nbsp;&lt;/p&gt; &lt;p style=&apos;margin:0pt;margin-bottom:.0001pt&apos;&gt;Research and development costs are expensed in the year in which they are incurred. &lt;/p&gt; &lt;p style=&apos;margin:0pt;margin-bottom:.0001pt&apos;&gt;&amp;nbsp;&lt;/p&gt; &lt;p style=&apos;margin:0pt;margin-bottom:.0001pt&apos;&gt;&amp;nbsp;&lt;/p&gt; &lt;p style=&apos;margin:0pt;margin-bottom:.0001pt&apos;&gt;i)&amp;#160;&amp;#160;&amp;#160;&amp;#160;&amp;#160;&amp;#160;&amp;#160;&amp;#160;&amp;#160; &lt;u&gt;Basic and Diluted Income (Loss) per Share&lt;/u&gt;&lt;/p&gt; &lt;p style=&apos;margin:0pt;margin-bottom:.0001pt&apos;&gt;&amp;nbsp;&lt;/p&gt; &lt;p style=&apos;margin:0pt;margin-bottom:.0001pt&apos;&gt;Earnings or loss per share (&amp;#147;EPS&amp;#148;) is computed by dividing net income (loss) available to common stockholders by the weighted average number of common shares outstanding for the period. Diluted EPS is computed by dividing net income (loss) by the weighted-average of all potentially dilutive shares of common stock that were outstanding during the periods presented. The number of shares potentially issuable at June 30, 2015 upon the exercise or conversion of share purchase warrants, share purchase options and conversion of convertible debentures totaled 5,877,500.&amp;#160; The number of shares potentially issuable at June 30, 2014 upon exercise or conversion of share purchase warrants and share purchase options and the conversion of convertible debentures totaled 9,130,000. &lt;/p&gt; &lt;p style=&apos;margin:0pt;margin-bottom:.0001pt&apos;&gt;The treasury stock method is used in calculating diluted EPS for potentially dilutive stock options and share purchase warrants, which assumes that any proceeds received from the exercise of in-the-money stock options and share purchase warrants, would be used to purchase common shares at the average market price for the period. &lt;/p&gt; &lt;p style=&apos;margin:0pt;margin-bottom:.0001pt&apos;&gt;EPS for convertible debt is calculated under the &amp;#147;if-converted&amp;#148; method. Under the if converted method, EPS is calculated as the more dilutive of EPS (i) including all interest (both cash interest and non-cash discount amortization) and excluding all shares underlying the Notes or; (ii) excluding all interest and costs directly related to the convertible debt (both cash interest and non-cash discount amortization) and including all shares underlying the convertible debt.&lt;/p&gt; &lt;p style=&apos;margin:0pt;margin-bottom:.0001pt&apos;&gt;The basic and diluted earnings per share for the years ended June 30, 2015 and 2014 were calculated as follows:&lt;/p&gt; &lt;p style=&apos;margin:0pt;margin-bottom:.0001pt&apos;&gt;&amp;nbsp;&lt;/p&gt; &lt;/td&gt; &lt;td width=&quot;147&quot; valign=&quot;top&quot; style=&apos;width:110.2pt;padding:0pt 5.4pt 0pt 5.4pt&apos;&gt; &lt;p align=&quot;right&quot; style=&apos;margin:0pt;margin-bottom:.0001pt;text-align:right&apos;&gt;&amp;nbsp;&lt;/p&gt; &lt;/td&gt; &lt;td width=&quot;147&quot; valign=&quot;top&quot; style=&apos;width:110.2pt;padding:0pt 5.4pt 0pt 5.4pt&apos;&gt; &lt;p align=&quot;right&quot; style=&apos;margin:0pt;margin-bottom:.0001pt;text-align:right&apos;&gt;&amp;nbsp;&lt;/p&gt; &lt;/td&gt; &lt;/tr&gt; &lt;tr align=&quot;left&quot;&gt; &lt;td width=&quot;328&quot; valign=&quot;top&quot; style=&apos;width:246.0pt;padding:0pt 5.4pt 0pt 5.4pt&apos;&gt; &lt;p style=&apos;margin:0pt;margin-bottom:.0001pt&apos;&gt;Common share options&lt;/p&gt; &lt;/td&gt; &lt;td width=&quot;147&quot; valign=&quot;top&quot; style=&apos;width:110.2pt;padding:0pt 5.4pt 0pt 5.4pt&apos;&gt; &lt;p align=&quot;right&quot; style=&apos;margin:0pt;margin-bottom:.0001pt;text-align:right&apos;&gt;2,697,321&lt;/p&gt; &lt;/td&gt; &lt;td width=&quot;147&quot; valign=&quot;top&quot; style=&apos;width:110.2pt;padding:0pt 5.4pt 0pt 5.4pt&apos;&gt; &lt;p align=&quot;right&quot; style=&apos;margin:0pt;margin-bottom:.0001pt;text-align:right&apos;&gt;1,633,215&lt;/p&gt; &lt;/td&gt; &lt;/tr&gt; &lt;tr align=&quot;left&quot;&gt; &lt;td width=&quot;328&quot; valign=&quot;top&quot; style=&apos;width:246.0pt;padding:0pt 5.4pt 0pt 5.4pt&apos;&gt; &lt;p style=&apos;margin:0pt;margin-bottom:.0001pt&apos;&gt;Common share warrants &lt;/p&gt; &lt;/td&gt; &lt;td width=&quot;147&quot; valign=&quot;top&quot; style=&apos;width:110.2pt;padding:0pt 5.4pt 0pt 5.4pt&apos;&gt; &lt;p align=&quot;right&quot; style=&apos;margin:0pt;margin-bottom:.0001pt;text-align:right&apos;&gt;1,664,678&lt;/p&gt; &lt;/td&gt; &lt;td width=&quot;147&quot; valign=&quot;top&quot; style=&apos;width:110.2pt;padding:0pt 5.4pt 0pt 5.4pt&apos;&gt; &lt;p align=&quot;right&quot; style=&apos;margin:0pt;margin-bottom:.0001pt;text-align:right&apos;&gt;866,259&lt;/p&gt; &lt;/td&gt; &lt;/tr&gt; &lt;tr align=&quot;left&quot;&gt; &lt;td width=&quot;328&quot; valign=&quot;top&quot; style=&apos;width:246.0pt;padding:0pt 5.4pt 0pt 5.4pt&apos;&gt; &lt;p style=&apos;margin:0pt;margin-bottom:.0001pt&apos;&gt;Convertible debentures&lt;/p&gt; &lt;/td&gt; &lt;td width=&quot;147&quot; valign=&quot;top&quot; style=&apos;width:110.2pt;border:none;border-bottom:solid windowtext 1.0pt;padding:0pt 5.4pt 0pt 5.4pt&apos;&gt; &lt;p align=&quot;right&quot; style=&apos;margin:0pt;margin-bottom:.0001pt;text-align:right&apos;&gt;2,400,000&lt;/p&gt; &lt;/td&gt; &lt;td width=&quot;147&quot; valign=&quot;top&quot; style=&apos;width:110.2pt;border:none;border-bottom:solid windowtext 1.0pt;padding:0pt 5.4pt 0pt 5.4pt&apos;&gt; &lt;p align=&quot;right&quot; style=&apos;margin:0pt;margin-bottom:.0001pt;text-align:right&apos;&gt;2,400,000&lt;/p&gt; &lt;/td&gt; &lt;/tr&gt; &lt;tr align=&quot;left&quot;&gt; &lt;td width=&quot;328&quot; valign=&quot;top&quot; style=&apos;width:246.0pt;padding:0pt 5.4pt 0pt 5.4pt&apos;&gt; &lt;p style=&apos;margin:0pt;margin-bottom:.0001pt&apos;&gt;Weighted average number of common shares outstanding used in computing diluted earnings per share&lt;/p&gt; &lt;/td&gt; &lt;td width=&quot;147&quot; valign=&quot;bottom&quot; style=&apos;width:110.2pt;border:none;border-bottom:solid windowtext 1.0pt;padding:0pt 5.4pt 0pt 5.4pt&apos;&gt; &lt;p align=&quot;right&quot; style=&apos;margin:0pt;margin-bottom:.0001pt;text-align:right&apos;&gt;51,753,562&lt;/p&gt; &lt;/td&gt; &lt;td width=&quot;147&quot; valign=&quot;bottom&quot; style=&apos;width:110.2pt;border:none;border-bottom:solid windowtext 1.0pt;padding:0pt 5.4pt 0pt 5.4pt&apos;&gt; &lt;p align=&quot;right&quot; style=&apos;margin:0pt;margin-bottom:.0001pt;text-align:right&apos;&gt;49,403,200&lt;/p&gt; &lt;/td&gt; &lt;/tr&gt; &lt;tr align=&quot;left&quot;&gt; &lt;td width=&quot;328&quot; valign=&quot;top&quot; style=&apos;width:246.0pt;width:230.4pt !msorm;padding:0pt 5.4pt 0pt 5.4pt 0pt 5.4pt 0pt 5.4pt !msorm&apos;&gt; &lt;p style=&apos;margin:0pt;margin-bottom:.0001pt&apos;&gt;&amp;nbsp;&lt;/p&gt; &lt;/td&gt; &lt;td width=&quot;147&quot; valign=&quot;top&quot; style=&apos;width:110.2pt;width:103.5pt !msorm;border:none;padding:0pt 5.4pt 0pt 5.4pt;border:none !msorm;border-top:solid windowtext 1.0pt !msorm;padding:0pt 5.4pt 0pt 5.4pt !msorm&apos;&gt; &lt;p align=&quot;right&quot; style=&apos;margin:0pt;margin-bottom:.0001pt;text-align:right&apos;&gt;&amp;nbsp;&lt;/p&gt; &lt;/td&gt; &lt;td width=&quot;147&quot; valign=&quot;top&quot; style=&apos;width:110.2pt;width:87.3pt !msorm;border:none;padding:0pt 5.4pt 0pt 5.4pt;border:none !msorm;padding:0pt 5.4pt 0pt 5.4pt !msorm&apos;&gt; &lt;p align=&quot;right&quot; style=&apos;margin:0pt;margin-bottom:.0001pt;text-align:right&apos;&gt;&amp;nbsp;&lt;/p&gt; &lt;/td&gt; &lt;/tr&gt; &lt;tr align=&quot;left&quot;&gt; &lt;td width=&quot;328&quot; valign=&quot;top&quot; style=&apos;width:246.0pt;width:230.4pt !msorm;padding:0pt 5.4pt 0pt 5.4pt 0pt 5.4pt 0pt 5.4pt !msorm&apos;&gt; &lt;p style=&apos;margin:0pt;margin-bottom:.0001pt&apos;&gt;Diluted earnings per share&lt;/p&gt; &lt;/td&gt; &lt;td width=&quot;147&quot; valign=&quot;top&quot; style=&apos;width:110.2pt;width:103.5pt !msorm;border:none;border-bottom:double windowtext 1.5pt;padding:0pt 5.4pt 0pt 5.4pt;border:none !msorm;border-bottom:double windowtext 1.5pt !msorm;padding:0pt 5.4pt 0pt 5.4pt !msorm&apos;&gt; &lt;p align=&quot;right&quot; style=&apos;margin:0pt;margin-bottom:.0001pt;text-align:right&apos;&gt;$0.01&lt;/p&gt; &lt;/td&gt; &lt;td width=&quot;147&quot; valign=&quot;top&quot; style=&apos;width:110.2pt;width:87.3pt !msorm;border:none;border-bottom:double windowtext 1.5pt;padding:0pt 5.4pt 0pt 5.4pt;border:none !msorm;border-bottom:double windowtext 1.5pt !msorm;padding:0pt 5.4pt 0pt 5.4pt !msorm&apos;&gt; &lt;p align=&quot;right&quot; style=&apos;margin:0pt;margin-bottom:.0001pt;text-align:right&apos;&gt;$0.01&lt;/p&gt; &lt;/td&gt; &lt;/tr&gt; &lt;/table&gt; &lt;p style=&apos;margin:0pt;margin-bottom:.0001pt&apos;&gt;&amp;nbsp;&lt;/p&gt; &lt;p style=&apos;margin:0pt;margin-bottom:.0001pt&apos;&gt;&amp;nbsp;&lt;/p&gt; &lt;p style=&apos;margin:0pt;margin-bottom:.0001pt&apos;&gt;&amp;nbsp;&lt;/p&gt; &lt;p style=&apos;margin:0pt;margin-bottom:.0001pt&apos;&gt;j)&amp;#160;&amp;#160;&amp;#160;&amp;#160;&amp;#160;&amp;#160;&amp;#160;&amp;#160;&amp;#160; &lt;u&gt;Fair Value Measurements&lt;/u&gt;&lt;/p&gt; &lt;p style=&apos;margin:0pt;margin-bottom:.0001pt&apos;&gt;&amp;nbsp;&lt;/p&gt; &lt;p style=&apos;margin:0pt;margin-bottom:.0001pt&apos;&gt;The book value of cash and cash equivalents, accounts receivable, accounts payable and accrued liabilities approximate their fair values due to the short term maturity of those instruments.&amp;#160; Based on borrowing rates currently available to the Company under similar terms, the book value of long term debt, and capital lease obligations approximate their fair values. The fair value hierarchy under GAAP is based on three levels of inputs, of which the first two are considered observable and the last unobservable, that may be used to measure fair value which are the following:&lt;/p&gt; &lt;p style=&apos;margin:0pt;margin-bottom:.0001pt&apos;&gt;&amp;nbsp;&lt;/p&gt; &lt;p style=&apos;margin:0pt;margin-bottom:.0001pt&apos;&gt;Level 1&amp;#160; -&amp;#160; quoted prices (unadjusted) in active markets for identical assets or liabilities;&lt;/p&gt; &lt;p style=&apos;margin:0pt;margin-bottom:.0001pt&apos;&gt;&amp;nbsp;&lt;/p&gt; &lt;p style=&apos;margin:0pt;margin-bottom:.0001pt&apos;&gt;Level 2&amp;#160; -&amp;#160; observable inputs other than Level I, quoted prices for similar assets or liabilities in active markets, quoted prices for identical or similar assets and liabilities in markets that are not active, and model-derived prices whose inputs are observable or whose significant value drivers are observable; and &lt;/p&gt; &lt;p style=&apos;margin:0pt;margin-bottom:.0001pt&apos;&gt;&amp;nbsp;&lt;/p&gt; &lt;p style=&apos;margin:0pt;margin-bottom:.0001pt&apos;&gt;Level 3&amp;#160; -&amp;#160; assets and liabilities whose significant value drivers are unobservable by little or no market activity and that are significant to the fair value of the assets or liabilities.&lt;/p&gt; &lt;p style=&apos;margin:0pt;margin-bottom:.0001pt&apos;&gt;&amp;nbsp;&lt;/p&gt; &lt;p style=&apos;margin:0pt;margin-bottom:.0001pt&apos;&gt;Certain of the Company&amp;#146;s cash equivalents, consisting of short-term term deposits, are based on Level 2 inputs in the ASC 820 fair value hierarchy.&lt;/p&gt; &lt;p style=&apos;margin:0pt;margin-bottom:.0001pt&apos;&gt;&amp;nbsp;&lt;/p&gt; &lt;p style=&apos;margin:0pt;margin-bottom:.0001pt&apos;&gt;The Company&amp;#146;s long-term debt is based on Level 2 inputs in the ASC 820 fair value hierarchy.&amp;#160; Based on the borrowing rates currently available to the Company for bank loans with similar terms and average maturities, the fair value of the long-term debt is $ nil (2014:&amp;#160; $312,110).&lt;/p&gt; &lt;p style=&apos;margin:0pt;margin-bottom:.0001pt&apos;&gt;&amp;nbsp;&lt;/p&gt; &lt;p style=&apos;margin:0pt;margin-bottom:.0001pt&apos;&gt;The Company&amp;#146;s convertible debentures are based on Level 2 inputs in the ASC 820 fair value hierarchy.&amp;#160; The Company calculates the fair value of these instruments by aggregating the fair values of each of the debt and equity components of the instrument.&lt;/p&gt; &lt;p style=&apos;margin:0pt;margin-bottom:.0001pt&apos;&gt;&amp;nbsp;&lt;/p&gt; &lt;p style=&apos;margin:0pt;margin-bottom:.0001pt&apos;&gt;The fair of debt component is calculated by discounting the future cash flows using a rate that is representative of the current arms-length borrowing rate. The fair value of the equity component is calculated by using the Black Scholes pricing model to determine the fair value of the warrant included in the equity unit issuable to the debt holder on conversion of the debt.&amp;#160; &lt;/p&gt; &lt;p style=&apos;margin:0pt;margin-bottom:.0001pt&apos;&gt;&amp;nbsp;&lt;/p&gt; &lt;p style=&apos;margin:0pt;margin-bottom:.0001pt&apos;&gt;At June 30, 2015, the convertible debentures had a fair value of $790,630 (2014:&amp;#160; $779,196).&lt;/p&gt; &lt;p style=&apos;margin:0pt;margin-bottom:.0001pt&apos;&gt;&amp;nbsp;&lt;/p&gt; &lt;p style=&apos;margin:0pt;margin-bottom:.0001pt&apos;&gt;Certain assets and liabilities are measured at fair value on a nonrecurring basis; that is, the instruments are not measured at fair value on an ongoing basis but are subject to fair value adjustments only in certain circumstances (for example, when there is evidence of impairment).&amp;#160; There were no assets or liabilities measured at fair value on a nonrecurring basis during the periods ended June 30, 2015 and 2014.&lt;/p&gt; &lt;p style=&apos;margin:0pt;margin-bottom:.0001pt&apos;&gt;&amp;nbsp;&lt;/p&gt; &lt;p style=&apos;margin:0pt;margin-bottom:.0001pt&apos;&gt;&amp;nbsp;&lt;/p&gt; &lt;p style=&apos;margin:0pt;margin-bottom:.0001pt&apos;&gt;k)&amp;#160;&amp;#160;&amp;#160;&amp;#160;&amp;#160;&amp;#160;&amp;#160;&amp;#160; &lt;u&gt;Accounts Receivable and Concentrations of Credit Risk&lt;/u&gt;&lt;/p&gt; &lt;p style=&apos;margin:0pt;margin-bottom:.0001pt&apos;&gt;&amp;nbsp;&lt;/p&gt; &lt;p style=&apos;margin:0pt;margin-bottom:.0001pt&apos;&gt;The Company grants credit to its customers in the normal course of business. Trade receivables are typically non-interest bearing and are initially recorded at cost. Sales to the Company&amp;#146;s recurring customers are generally made on open account terms. Past due status of customer accounts is determined based on how recently payments have been received in relation to payment terms granted. Credit is generally extended based upon an evaluation of each customer&amp;#146;s financial condition, with terms consistent in the industry and no collateral required. Losses from credit sales are provided for in the financial statements and consistently have been within the allowance provided. The allowance is an estimate of the ability to collect accounts receivable based on an evaluation of specific customer risks along with additional reserves based on historical and probable bad debt experience. Amounts are written off against the allowance in the period the Company determines that the receivable is uncollectible. The Company has not recorded an allowance for doubtful accounts against its accounts receivable in each of the years ended June 30, 2015 and June 30, 2014.&lt;/p&gt; &lt;p style=&apos;margin:0pt;margin-bottom:.0001pt&apos;&gt;&amp;nbsp;&lt;/p&gt; &lt;p style=&apos;margin:0pt;margin-bottom:.0001pt&apos;&gt;&amp;nbsp;&lt;/p&gt; &lt;p style=&apos;margin:0pt;margin-bottom:.0001pt&apos;&gt;(l)&amp;#160;&amp;#160;&amp;#160;&amp;#160;&amp;#160;&amp;#160;&amp;#160;&amp;#160; &lt;u&gt;Currency Risk&lt;/u&gt;&lt;/p&gt; &lt;p style=&apos;margin:0pt;margin-bottom:.0001pt&apos;&gt;&amp;nbsp;&lt;/p&gt; &lt;p style=&apos;margin:0pt;margin-bottom:.0001pt&apos;&gt;During the year ended June 30, 2015, the Company realized a foreign exchange gain of $nil (2014: $611) as a result of the Company having some vendor payments that were paid in Canadian dollars.&lt;/p&gt; &lt;p style=&apos;margin:0pt;margin-bottom:.0001pt&apos;&gt;&amp;nbsp;&lt;/p&gt; &lt;p style=&apos;margin:0pt;margin-bottom:.0001pt&apos;&gt;&amp;nbsp;&lt;/p&gt; &lt;p style=&apos;margin:0pt;margin-bottom:.0001pt&apos;&gt;m)&amp;#160;&amp;#160;&amp;#160;&amp;#160;&amp;#160;&amp;#160;&amp;#160; &lt;u&gt;Revenue Recognition&lt;/u&gt;&lt;/p&gt; &lt;p style=&apos;margin:0pt;margin-bottom:.0001pt&apos;&gt;&amp;nbsp;&lt;/p&gt; &lt;p style=&apos;margin:0pt;margin-bottom:.0001pt&apos;&gt;The Company recognizes revenue in accordance with Financial Accounting Standards Board&amp;#146;s (&amp;#147;FASB&amp;#148;) Accounting Standards Codification (&amp;#147;ASC&amp;#148;) 605, &amp;#147;Revenue Recognition&amp;#148;, which requires that: (i) persuasive evidence of an arrangement exists, (ii) delivery has occurred, (iii) the sales price is fixed and determinable, and (iv) collection is reasonably assured. The Company recognizes revenue when the building supplies have been shipped.&lt;/p&gt; &lt;p style=&apos;margin:0pt;margin-bottom:.0001pt&apos;&gt;&amp;nbsp;&lt;/p&gt; &lt;p style=&apos;margin:0pt;margin-bottom:.0001pt&apos;&gt;Revenue for LP&amp;#174; FlameBlock Fire-Rated OSB Sheathing includes only the charges for treatment services, not the underlying OSB substrate or outbound freight as the customer supplies its own OSB Substrate and contracts for its own outgoing freight.&lt;/p&gt; &lt;p style=&apos;margin:0pt;margin-bottom:.0001pt&apos;&gt;&amp;nbsp;&lt;/p&gt; &lt;p style=&apos;margin:0pt;margin-bottom:.0001pt&apos;&gt;The Company periodically enters into arrangements that contain multiple deliverable elements requiring an evaluation of each deliverable to determine whether it represents a separate unit of accounting. Each delivered item constitutes a separate unit of accounting when it has stand-alone value to the customer obligating the Company to determine a selling price for each deliverable. During the year ended June 30, 2014, the Company entered into a license fee agreement by which the Company was required to transfer a license of its intellectual property to the licensee along with providing follow-up technical support and assistance. The licensee paid an upfront fee of $100,000 which was recognized in revenue for the year ended June 30, 2014 as the Company had completed its obligations. In accordance with the terms of the agreement the licensee pays royalties to the Company for the product it manufactures and sells.&amp;#160; License fees are recognized as earned in accordance with the terms of the agreement when the license fees can be reasonably estimated and collectability is reasonably assured. &lt;/p&gt; &lt;p style=&apos;margin:0pt;margin-bottom:.0001pt&apos;&gt;&amp;nbsp;&lt;/p&gt; &lt;p style=&apos;margin:0pt;margin-bottom:.0001pt&apos;&gt;n)&amp;#160;&amp;#160;&amp;#160;&amp;#160;&amp;#160;&amp;#160;&amp;#160;&amp;#160; &lt;u&gt;Income Taxes&lt;/u&gt;&lt;/p&gt; &lt;p style=&apos;margin:0pt;margin-bottom:.0001pt&apos;&gt;&amp;nbsp;&lt;/p&gt; &lt;p style=&apos;margin:0pt;margin-bottom:.0001pt&apos;&gt;The Company follows the liability method of accounting for income taxes.&amp;#160; Under this method, current income taxes are recognized for the estimated income taxes payable for the current year.&amp;#160; Deferred income tax assets and liabilities are recognized in the current year for temporary differences between the tax and accounting basis of assets and liabilities as well as for the benefit of losses available to be carried forward to future years for tax purposes.&amp;#160; Deferred income tax assets and liabilities are measured using tax rates and laws expected to apply in the years in which those temporary differences are expected to be recovered or settled.&amp;#160; The effect of a change in tax rates on deferred income tax assets and liabilities is recognized in operations in the year of change.&amp;#160; A valuation allowance is recorded when it is &amp;#147;more likely-than-not&amp;#148; that a deferred tax asset will not be realized.&lt;/p&gt; &lt;p style=&apos;margin:0pt;margin-bottom:.0001pt&apos;&gt;&amp;nbsp;&lt;/p&gt; &lt;p style=&apos;margin:0pt;margin-bottom:.0001pt&apos;&gt;&amp;nbsp;&lt;/p&gt; &lt;p style=&apos;margin:0pt;margin-bottom:.0001pt&apos;&gt;o)&amp;#160;&amp;#160;&amp;#160;&amp;#160;&amp;#160;&amp;#160;&amp;#160;&amp;#160; &lt;u&gt;Stock-based Compensation&lt;/u&gt;&lt;/p&gt; &lt;p style=&apos;margin:0pt;margin-bottom:.0001pt&apos;&gt;&amp;nbsp;&lt;/p&gt; &lt;p style=&apos;margin:0pt;margin-bottom:.0001pt&apos;&gt;The Company accounts for all stock-based payments and awards under the fair value based method.&lt;/p&gt; &lt;p style=&apos;margin:0pt;margin-bottom:.0001pt&apos;&gt;&amp;nbsp;&lt;/p&gt; &lt;p style=&apos;margin:0pt;margin-bottom:.0001pt&apos;&gt;Stock-based payments to non-employees are measured at the fair value of the consideration received, or the fair value of the equity instruments issued, or liabilities incurred, whichever is more reliably measurable. The fair value of stock-based payments to non-employees is periodically re-measured until the counterparty performance is complete, and any change therein is recognized over the vesting period of the award and in the same manner as if the Company had paid cash instead of paying with or using equity based instruments. The cost of the stock-based payments to non-employees that is fully vested and non-forfeitable as at the grant date is measured and recognized at that date. &lt;/p&gt; &lt;p style=&apos;margin:0pt;margin-bottom:.0001pt&apos;&gt;&amp;nbsp;&lt;/p&gt; &lt;p style=&apos;margin:0pt;margin-bottom:.0001pt&apos;&gt;The Company accounts for the granting of share purchase options to employees using the fair value method whereby all awards to employees will be recorded at fair value on the date of the grant.&amp;#160; The fair value of all share purchase options are expensed over their vesting period with a corresponding increase to additional capital surplus.&amp;#160; Upon exercise of share purchase options, the consideration paid by the option holder, together with the amount previously recognized in additional paid-in capital is recorded as an increase to share capital. Share purchase options granted to employees are accounted for as liabilities when they contain conditions or other features that are indexed to other than a market, performance or service condition.&amp;#160; The Company uses the Black-Scholes option pricing model to calculate the fair value of share purchase options and the binomial option pricing model to determine the fair value of all stock based awards classified as liabilities.&amp;#160; Option pricing models require the input of highly subjective assumptions, including the expected price volatility.&amp;#160; Changes in these assumptions can materially affect the fair value estimate.&lt;/p&gt; &lt;p style=&apos;margin:0pt;margin-bottom:.0001pt&apos;&gt;&amp;nbsp;&lt;/p&gt; &lt;p style=&apos;margin:0pt;margin-bottom:.0001pt&apos;&gt;&amp;nbsp;&lt;/p&gt; &lt;p style=&apos;margin:0pt;margin-bottom:.0001pt&apos;&gt;p)&amp;#160;&amp;#160;&amp;#160;&amp;#160;&amp;#160;&amp;#160;&amp;#160;&amp;#160; &lt;u&gt;Recently Issued Accounting Pronouncements&lt;/u&gt;&lt;/p&gt; &lt;p style=&apos;margin:0pt;margin-bottom:.0001pt&apos;&gt;&amp;nbsp;&lt;/p&gt; &lt;p style=&apos;margin:0pt;margin-bottom:.0001pt&apos;&gt;In May 2014, the Financial Accounting Standards Board (FASB) issued Accounting Standards Update (ASU) No. 2014-09 regarding Accounting Standards Codification (ASC) Topic 606, Revenue from Contracts with Customers. The standard provides principles for recognizing revenue for the transfer of promised goods or services to customers with the consideration to which the entity expects to be entitled in exchange for those goods or services. The guidance was to be effective for the Company in the first quarter of the June 30, 2018 fiscal year using either of two methods: (i) retrospective to each prior reporting period presented with the option to elect certain practical expedients as defined within the guidance; or (ii) retrospective with the cumulative effect of initially applying the guidance recognized at the date of initial application and providing certain additional disclosures as defined per the guidance. &amp;#160;In August 2015, the FASB issued ASU 2015-14 to defer the effective date of the guidance contained in ASU 2014-15 by one year. Thus, the guidance is effective for the Company commencing in the first quarter of the June 30, 2019 fiscal year. Management is currently evaluating the accounting, transition and disclosure requirements of the standard and cannot currently estimate the financial statement impact of adoption.&lt;/p&gt; &lt;p style=&apos;margin:0pt;margin-bottom:.0001pt&apos;&gt;&amp;nbsp;&lt;/p&gt; &lt;p style=&apos;margin:0pt;margin-bottom:.0001pt&apos;&gt;&amp;nbsp;&lt;/p&gt; &lt;p style=&apos;margin:0pt;margin-bottom:.0001pt;text-autospace:none;text-align:justify&apos;&gt;q)&amp;#160;&amp;#160;&amp;#160;&amp;#160;&amp;#160;&amp;#160;&amp;#160;&amp;#160; &lt;u&gt;Comparative Financial Information&lt;/u&gt;&lt;/p&gt; &lt;p style=&apos;margin:0pt;margin-bottom:.0001pt;text-autospace:none;text-align:justify&apos;&gt;&amp;nbsp;&lt;/p&gt; &lt;p style=&apos;margin:0pt;margin-bottom:.0001pt;text-autospace:none&apos;&gt;Certain of the comparative financial information has been reclassified to conform with the financial statement presentation in the current year.&lt;/p&gt; &lt;p style=&apos;margin:0pt;margin-bottom:.0001pt;text-autospace:none&apos;&gt;&amp;nbsp;&lt;/p&gt; &lt;p style=&apos;margin:0pt;margin-bottom:.0001pt&apos;&gt;&amp;nbsp;&lt;/p&gt;</us-gaap:SignificantAccountingPoliciesTextBlock>	<us-gaap:InventoryDisclosureTextBlock contextRef='D140701_150630'>&lt;!--egx--&gt;&lt;p style=&apos;margin:0pt;margin-bottom:.0001pt&apos;&gt;Note 3&amp;#160;&amp;#160;&amp;#160;&amp;#160;&amp;#160;&amp;#160;&amp;#160; &lt;u&gt;Inventory&lt;/u&gt;&lt;/p&gt; &lt;p style=&apos;margin:0pt;margin-bottom:.0001pt&apos;&gt;&amp;nbsp;&lt;/p&gt; &lt;p style=&apos;margin:0pt;margin-bottom:.0001pt&apos;&gt;&amp;nbsp;&lt;/p&gt; &lt;table border=&quot;0&quot; cellspacing=&quot;0&quot; cellpadding=&quot;0&quot; width=&quot;483&quot; style=&apos;width:362.3pt;border-collapse:collapse&apos;&gt; &lt;tr style=&apos;height:12.75pt&apos;&gt; &lt;td width=&quot;219&quot; valign=&quot;bottom&quot; style=&apos;width:164.0pt;padding:0pt 5.4pt 0pt 5.4pt;height:12.75pt&apos;&gt; &lt;p style=&apos;margin:0pt;margin-bottom:.0001pt&apos;&gt;&amp;nbsp;&lt;/p&gt; This amount is included in cost of sales in the Statement of Operations.&lt;/p&gt; &lt;p style=&apos;margin:0pt;margin-bottom:.0001pt&apos;&gt;&amp;nbsp;&lt;/p&gt; &lt;p style=&apos;margin:0pt;margin-bottom:.0001pt&apos;&gt;Depreciation of assets under capital leases included in amortization expense for the year ended June 30, 2015 was $113,514 (2014:&amp;#160; $99,752).&lt;/p&gt;</us-gaap:PropertyPlantAndEquipmentDisclosureTextBlock>	<us-gaap:ConvertibleDebtTableTextBlock contextRef='D140701_150630'>&lt;!--egx--&gt;&lt;p style=&apos;margin:0pt;margin-bottom:.0001pt&apos;&gt;Note 5&amp;#160;&amp;#160;&amp;#160;&amp;#160; &lt;u&gt;Convertible Debenture&lt;/u&gt;&lt;/p&gt; &lt;p style=&apos;margin:0pt;margin-bottom:.0001pt&apos;&gt;&amp;nbsp;&lt;/p&gt; &lt;p style=&apos;margin:0pt;margin-bottom:.0001pt&apos;&gt;During the year ended June 30, 2012, the Company approved the issuance of two convertible promissory debentures to a director and a company controlled by a director in the amount of $300,000.&amp;#160; The debentures are being issued in tranches from $10,000 - $50,000 and as at June 30, 2015 the Company had received $240,000 (2014:&amp;#160; $240,000) in respect of these debentures.&amp;#160; The debentures bear interest at 12% per annum, payable quarterly, and are collateralized by a third charge over the Company&amp;#146;s plant and equipment as well as a charge against the Company&amp;#146;s patents.&amp;#160; At any time, the notes are convertible into units of the Company at a price of $0.10 per unit.&amp;#160; Each unit will consist of one common share and one common share purchase warrant entitling the holder the right to purchase one additional share for $0.10 for a period of two years from the conversion date.&amp;#160; During the year ended June 30, 2015, the Company incurred interest charges of $28,800 (2014:&amp;#160; $28,800) on these convertible debentures. The promissory debentures mature on January 30, 2017.&lt;/p&gt;</us-gaap:ConvertibleDebtTableTextBlock>	<us-gaap:LongTermDebtTextBlock contextRef='D140701_150630'>&lt;!--egx--&gt;&lt;p style=&apos;margin:0pt;margin-bottom:.0001pt&apos;&gt;Note 6&amp;#160;&amp;#160;&amp;#160;&amp;#160; &lt;p style=&apos;margin:0pt;margin-bottom:.0001pt&apos;&gt;Revolving promissory note in the amount of $500,000 bearing interest at 5.5% per annum and is unsecured.&amp;#160; The promissory note is repayable on demand, but if no demand for repayment is made, on June 22, 2016.&amp;#160; As at June 30, 2015, the Company has not drawn any funds on this note.&lt;/p&gt; &lt;p style=&apos;margin:0pt;margin-bottom:.0001pt&apos;&gt;&amp;nbsp;&lt;/p&gt; &lt;p style=&apos;margin:0pt;margin-bottom:.0001pt&apos;&gt;&amp;nbsp;&lt;/p&gt; &lt;/td&gt; &lt;/tr&gt; &lt;/table&gt; &lt;p style=&apos;margin:0pt;margin-bottom:.0001pt&apos;&gt;&amp;nbsp;&lt;/p&gt; &lt;p style=&apos;margin:0pt;margin-bottom:.0001pt&apos;&gt;&amp;nbsp;&lt;/p&gt; &lt;p style=&apos;margin:0pt;margin-bottom:.0001pt&apos;&gt;The capital leases bear interest at various rates from 4.00% to 6% per annum.&lt;/p&gt; &lt;p style=&apos;margin:0pt;margin-bottom:.0001pt&apos;&gt;&amp;nbsp;&lt;/p&gt; &lt;p style=&apos;margin:0pt;margin-bottom:.0001pt&apos;&gt;Interest on capital leases included in interest on long-term debt for the year ended June 30, 2015 was $6,633 (2014:&amp;#160; $9,925).&lt;/p&gt; &lt;p style=&apos;margin:0pt;margin-bottom:.0001pt&apos;&gt;&amp;nbsp;&lt;/p&gt;</us-gaap:CapitalLeasesInFinancialStatementsOfLesseeDisclosureTextBlock>	<us-gaap:StockholdersEquityNoteDisclosureTextBlock contextRef='D140701_150630'>&lt;!--egx--&gt;&lt;p style=&apos;margin:0pt;margin-bottom:.0001pt&apos;&gt;Note 8&amp;#160;&amp;#160;&amp;#160;&amp;#160;&amp;#160;&amp;#160;&amp;#160; &lt;u&gt;Common Stock&lt;/u&gt;&lt;/p&gt; &lt;p style=&apos;margin:0pt;margin-bottom:.0001pt&apos;&gt;&amp;nbsp;&lt;/p&gt; &lt;p style=&apos;margin:0pt;margin-bottom:.0001pt&apos;&gt;a)&amp;#160;&amp;#160;&amp;#160;&amp;#160;&amp;#160;&amp;#160;&amp;#160;&amp;#160;&amp;#160;&amp;#160;&amp;#160;&amp;#160;&amp;#160;&amp;#160; Escrow:&lt;/p&gt; &lt;p style=&apos;margin:0pt;margin-bottom:.0001pt&apos;&gt;&amp;nbsp;&lt;/p&gt; &lt;p style=&apos;margin-top:6.0pt;margin-right:0pt;margin-bottom:0pt;margin-left:72.0pt;margin-bottom:.0001pt;text-align:justify;margin:0pt;margin-bottom:.0001pt&apos;&gt;&lt;font lang=&quot;EN-GB&quot;&gt;At June 30, 2015, there are &lt;/font&gt;&lt;font lang=&quot;EN-GB&quot;&gt;48,922&lt;/font&gt;&lt;font lang=&quot;EN-GB&quot;&gt; (2014 &amp;#150; &lt;/font&gt;&lt;font lang=&quot;EN-GB&quot;&gt;48,922&lt;/font&gt;&lt;font lang=&quot;EN-GB&quot;&gt;) common shares held in escrow by the Company&amp;#146;s transfer agent, the release which is subject to the approval of the regulatory authorities. As at June 30, 2015, all of these shares held in escrow are issuable but the Company has yet to request their release.&amp;#160; These shares have been included in the computation of net loss per share.&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/p&gt; &lt;p style=&apos;margin:0pt;margin-bottom:.0001pt&apos;&gt;&amp;nbsp;&lt;/p&gt; &lt;p style=&apos;margin:0pt;margin-bottom:.0001pt&apos;&gt;b)&amp;#160;&amp;#160;&amp;#160;&amp;#160;&amp;#160;&amp;#160;&amp;#160;&amp;#160;&amp;#160;&amp;#160;&amp;#160;&amp;#160;&amp;#160;&amp;#160; Commitments:&lt;/p&gt; &lt;p style=&apos;margin:0pt;margin-bottom:.0001pt&apos;&gt;&amp;nbsp;&lt;/p&gt; &lt;p style=&apos;margin:0pt;margin-bottom:.0001pt&apos;&gt;Stock-based Compensation Plan&lt;/p&gt; &lt;p style=&apos;margin:0pt;margin-bottom:.0001pt&apos;&gt;&amp;nbsp;&lt;/p&gt; &lt;p style=&apos;margin:0pt;margin-bottom:.0001pt&apos;&gt;In November 2005, the Company continued its rolling stock option plan (&amp;#147;the 2005 Rolling Plan&amp;#148;).&amp;#160; The 2005 Rolling Plan provides for the granting of stock options to selected directors, officers, employees or consultants in an aggregate amount of up to 10% of the issued and outstanding common shares of the Company.&amp;#160; Under the 2005 Rolling Plan, the granting of stock options, exercise prices and terms are determined by the Company&apos;s Board of Directors. Options granted to non-executive employees and consultants typically vest in stages over various periods of time while options granted to Directors and executive employees vest immediately upon their grant. The exercise price shall not be less than the Discounted Market Price, which is defined as the last closing price of the common shares before the date of the grant less an applicable discount, as allowed by the regulatory authorities. Options granted under the 2005 Rolling Plan may not exceed&amp;#160; a term of 5 years unless the Company achieves classification as a &amp;#147;Tier 1 &amp;#147; issuer in accordance with the policies of the TSX, in which case, the options may be granted for a maximum term of 10 years.&lt;/p&gt; &lt;p style=&apos;margin:0pt;margin-bottom:.0001pt&apos;&gt;&amp;nbsp;&lt;/p&gt; &lt;p style=&apos;margin:0pt;margin-bottom:.0001pt&apos;&gt;A summary of the status of the Company&amp;#146;s share purchase option plan as of June 30, 2015 and 2014 and changes during the years ending on those dates is presented below:&lt;/p&gt; &lt;p style=&apos;margin:0pt;margin-bottom:.0001pt;text-align:justify;text-indent:36.0pt;text-indent:0pt&apos;&gt;&amp;nbsp;&lt;/p&gt; &lt;p style=&apos;margin:0pt;margin-bottom:.0001pt;text-align:justify;text-indent:36.0pt;text-indent:0pt&apos;&gt;The weighted-average grant date fair value of options granted during the years 2015 and 2014 was nil and $0.056 respectively. &lt;/p&gt; &lt;p style=&apos;margin:0pt;margin-bottom:.0001pt;text-align:justify;text-indent:36.0pt;text-indent:0pt&apos;&gt;&amp;nbsp;&lt;/p&gt; &lt;p style=&apos;margin:0pt;margin-bottom:.0001pt;text-align:justify;text-indent:36.0pt;text-indent:0pt&apos;&gt;As June 30, 2015, the total unamortized stock-based compensation cost expected to vest in future fiscal periods is $Nil (2014: $Nil). &lt;/p&gt; &lt;p style=&apos;margin:0pt;margin-bottom:.0001pt&apos;&gt;&amp;nbsp;&lt;/p&gt; &lt;p style=&apos;margin:0pt;margin-bottom:.0001pt;text-align:justify;text-indent:36.0pt;text-indent:0pt&apos;&gt;&lt;u&gt;Employee Share Purchase Options&lt;/u&gt;&lt;/p&gt; &lt;p style=&apos;margin:0pt;margin-bottom:.0001pt;text-align:justify;text-indent:36.0pt;text-indent:0pt&apos;&gt;&amp;nbsp;&lt;/p&gt; &lt;p style=&apos;margin:0pt;margin-bottom:.0001pt;text-align:justify;text-indent:36.0pt;text-indent:0pt&apos;&gt;During the year ended June 30, 2014, the Company granted 1,177,500 fully vested share purchase options having a fair value of $65,359. &lt;/p&gt; &lt;p style=&apos;margin:0pt;margin-bottom:.0001pt;text-align:justify;text-indent:36.0pt;text-indent:0pt&apos;&gt;&amp;nbsp;&lt;/p&gt; &lt;p style=&apos;margin:0pt;margin-bottom:.0001pt;text-align:justify;text-indent:36.0pt;text-indent:0pt&apos;&gt;The fair value of the stock options granted was calculated using the Black Scholes option pricing model using the following weighted average assumptions: stock price - $0.058; exercise price - $0.097; expected life &amp;#150;3.0 yrs; volatility: 246.16%, risk-free discount rate: 0.59%, dividend rate &amp;#150;0.00%.&lt;/p&gt; &lt;p style=&apos;margin:0pt;margin-bottom:.0001pt;text-align:justify;text-indent:36.0pt;text-indent:0pt&apos;&gt;&amp;nbsp;&lt;/p&gt;</us-gaap:StockholdersEquityNoteDisclosureTextBlock>	<us-gaap:ResearchDevelopmentAndComputerSoftwareDisclosureTextBlock contextRef='D140701_150630'>&lt;!--egx--&gt;&lt;p style=&apos;margin:0pt;margin-bottom:.0001pt&apos;&gt;Note 9&amp;#160;&amp;#160;&amp;#160;&amp;#160;&amp;#160;&amp;#160;&amp;#160; &lt;p style=&apos;margin:0pt;margin-bottom:.0001pt&apos;&gt;Net deferred tax assets&lt;/p&gt; &lt;/td&gt; &lt;td width=&quot;118&quot; valign=&quot;bottom&quot; style=&apos;width:88.8pt;border:none;border-bottom:double windowtext 2.25pt;padding:0pt 5.4pt 0pt 5.4pt;height:13.5pt&apos;&gt; &lt;p align=&quot;right&quot; style=&apos;margin:0pt;margin-bottom:.0001pt;text-align:right&apos;&gt;$&amp;#160;&amp;#160;&amp;#160;&amp;#160;&amp;#160;&amp;#160;&amp;#160;&amp;#160;&amp;#160;&amp;#160;&amp;#160;&amp;#160;&amp;#160;&amp;#160;&amp;#160;&amp;#160;&amp;#160; 0&lt;/p&gt; &lt;/td&gt; &lt;td width=&quot;115&quot; valign=&quot;bottom&quot; style=&apos;width:85.9pt;border:none;border-bottom:double windowtext 2.25pt;padding:0pt 5.4pt 0pt 5.4pt;height:13.5pt&apos;&gt; &lt;p align=&quot;right&quot; style=&apos;margin:0pt;margin-bottom:.0001pt;text-align:right&apos;&gt;$&amp;#160;&amp;#160;&amp;#160;&amp;#160;&amp;#160;&amp;#160;&amp;#160;&amp;#160;&amp;#160;&amp;#160;&amp;#160;&amp;#160;&amp;#160;&amp;#160;&amp;#160;&amp;#160;&amp;#160; 0&lt;/p&gt; &lt;/td&gt; &lt;/tr&gt; &lt;/table&gt; &lt;p align=&quot;left&quot; style=&apos;margin:0pt;margin-bottom:.0001pt;text-align:justify;text-align:left&apos;&gt;&amp;nbsp;&lt;/p&gt; &lt;p style=&apos;margin:0pt;margin-bottom:.0001pt;text-align:justify&apos;&gt;&amp;nbsp;&lt;/p&gt; &lt;p style=&apos;margin-bottom:0pt;margin-bottom:.0001pt;text-align:justify&apos;&gt;The Company evaluates its valuation allowance requirements based on projected future operations. When circumstances change and this causes a change in management&amp;#146;s judgment about the recoverability of future tax assets, the impact of the change on the valuation allowance is reflected in current income. As management of the Company does not currently believe that it is more likely than not that the Company will receive the benefit of this asset, a valuation allowance equal to the future tax asset has been established at both June 30, 2015 and June 30, 2014. &lt;/p&gt; &lt;p style=&apos;margin:0pt;margin-bottom:.0001pt;text-align:justify&apos;&gt;&amp;nbsp;&lt;/p&gt; &lt;p style=&apos;margin:0pt;margin-bottom:.0001pt;text-align:justify&apos;&gt;As at June 30, 2015, the Company had estimated net operating loss carry-forwards available to reduce taxable income in future years, which were incurred in the United States and Canada as follows: &lt;/p&gt; &lt;/td&gt; &lt;td width=&quot;97&quot; valign=&quot;bottom&quot; style=&apos;width:73.0pt;border:none;border-bottom:double windowtext 2.25pt;padding:0pt 5.4pt 0pt 5.4pt;height:13.5pt&apos;&gt; &lt;p align=&quot;right&quot; &lt;p align=&quot;right&quot; style=&apos;margin:0pt;margin-bottom:.0001pt;text-align:right&apos;&gt;$&amp;#160;&amp;#160; 1,759,000&lt;/p&gt; &lt;/td&gt; &lt;td width=&quot;110&quot; valign=&quot;bottom&quot; 3,374,000&lt;/p&gt; &lt;/td&gt; &lt;/tr&gt; &lt;/table&gt; &lt;p style=&apos;margin:0pt;margin-bottom:.0001pt&apos;&gt;&amp;nbsp;&lt;/p&gt; &lt;p style=&apos;margin:0pt;margin-bottom:.0001pt&apos;&gt;&amp;nbsp;&lt;/p&gt; &lt;p style=&apos;margin:0pt;margin-bottom:.0001pt&apos;&gt;&lt;i&gt;Uncertain Tax Positions&lt;/i&gt;&lt;/p&gt; &lt;p style=&apos;margin:0pt;margin-bottom:.0001pt&apos;&gt;&amp;nbsp;&lt;/p&gt; &lt;p style=&apos;margin:0pt;margin-bottom:.0001pt&apos;&gt;The Company &amp;#160;records liabilities related to uncertain tax positions in accordance with the guidance that clarifies the accounting for uncertainty in income taxes recognized in an enterprise&apos;s financial statements by prescribing a minimum recognition threshold and measurement attribute for the financial statement recognition and measurement of a tax position taken or expected to be taken in a tax return. At June 30, 2015, the Company does not have an accrual relating to uncertain tax positions. It is not anticipated that unrecognized tax benefits would significantly increase or decrease within 12 months of the reporting date.&lt;/p&gt; &lt;p style=&apos;margin:0pt;margin-bottom:.0001pt&apos;&gt;&amp;nbsp;&lt;/p&gt; &lt;p style=&apos;margin:0pt;margin-bottom:.0001pt&apos;&gt;The Company files income tax returns in the U.S. federal jurisdiction, various state and foreign jurisdictions.&amp;#160; The Company&amp;#146;s tax returns are subject to tax examinations by U.S. federal and state tax authorities, or examinations by foreign tax authorities until respective statute of limitation.&amp;#160; The Company currently has no tax years under examination. The Company is subject to tax examinations by tax authorities for all taxation years commencing after 2004.&lt;/p&gt; &lt;p style=&apos;margin:0pt;margin-bottom:.0001pt&apos;&gt;&amp;nbsp;&lt;/p&gt; &lt;p align=&quot;left&quot; style=&apos;margin:0pt;margin-bottom:.0001pt;text-align:justify;text-align:left&apos;&gt;&lt;font lang=&quot;EN-GB&quot;&gt;Provision has not been made for U.S. or additional foreign taxes on undistributed earnings of foreign subsidiaries. Such earnings have been and will continue to be reinvested but could become subject to additional tax if they were remitted as dividends, or were loaned to the Company affiliate. It is not practicable to determine the amount of additional tax, if any, that might be payable on the undistributed foreign earnings. &lt;/font&gt;&lt;/p&gt; &lt;p align=&quot;left&quot; style=&apos;margin:0pt;margin-bottom:.0001pt;text-align:justify;text-align:left&apos;&gt;&amp;nbsp;&lt;/p&gt;</us-gaap:IncomeTaxDisclosureTextBlock>	<us-gaap:SegmentReportingDisclosureTextBlock contextRef='D140701_150630'>&lt;!--egx--&gt;&lt;p style=&apos;margin:0pt;margin-bottom:.0001pt;text-align:justify&apos;&gt;Note 11&amp;#160;&amp;#160;&amp;#160;&amp;#160;&amp;#160;&amp;#160; &lt;u&gt;Segmented information and sales concentration&lt;/u&gt;&lt;/p&gt; &lt;p style=&apos;margin:0pt;margin-bottom:.0001pt;text-align:justify&apos;&gt;&amp;nbsp;&lt;/p&gt; &lt;p align=&quot;left&quot; style=&apos;margin:0pt;margin-bottom:.0001pt;text-align:justify;text-align:left&apos;&gt;&amp;#160;&amp;#160;&amp;#160;&amp;#160;&amp;#160;&amp;#160;&amp;#160;&amp;#160;&amp;#160;&amp;#160;&amp;#160;&amp;#160;&amp;#160;&amp;#160;&amp;#160;&amp;#160;&amp;#160; &lt;font lang=&quot;EN-GB&quot;&gt;The Company operates in one industry segment being the manufacturing and marketing of fire resistant building materials. All of the Company&amp;#146;s revenues and substantially all of the long-term assets are located in the United States. &lt;/font&gt;&lt;/p&gt; &lt;p style=&apos;margin:0pt;margin-bottom:.0001pt;text-align:justify&apos;&gt;&amp;nbsp;&lt;/p&gt; &lt;p style=&apos;margin:0pt;margin-bottom:.0001pt;text-align:justify&apos;&gt;&amp;nbsp;&lt;/p&gt; &lt;table border=&quot;0&quot; cellspacing=&quot;0&quot; cellpadding=&quot;0&quot; width=&quot;511&quot; &lt;p style=&apos;margin:0pt;margin-bottom:.0001pt&apos;&gt;&amp;nbsp;&lt;/p&gt; &lt;/td&gt; &lt;td width=&quot;88&quot; valign=&quot;bottom&quot; style=&apos;width:66.0pt;padding:0pt 5.4pt 0pt 5.4pt;height:15.0pt&apos;&gt; &lt;u&gt;Subsequent Events&lt;/u&gt;&lt;/p&gt; &lt;p style=&apos;margin:0pt;margin-bottom:.0001pt;text-align:justify&apos;&gt;&amp;nbsp;&lt;/p&gt; &lt;p style=&apos;margin:0pt;margin-bottom:.0001pt&apos;&gt;In August 2015, the Company granted an additional license for the manufacture and distribution of Pyrotite products. &lt;/p&gt; 	<us-gaap:ConsolidationPolicyTextBlock contextRef='D140701_150630'>&lt;!--egx--&gt;&lt;p style=&apos;margin:0pt;margin-bottom:.0001pt&apos;&gt;a)&amp;#160;&amp;#160;&amp;#160;&amp;#160;&amp;#160;&amp;#160;&amp;#160;&amp;#160; &lt;u&gt;Principles of Consolidation&lt;/u&gt;&lt;/p&gt; &lt;p style=&apos;margin:0pt;margin-bottom:.0001pt&apos;&gt;&amp;nbsp;&lt;/p&gt; &lt;p style=&apos;margin:0pt;margin-bottom:.0001pt&apos;&gt;These consolidated financial statements include the accounts of International Barrier Technology Inc. and its wholly-owned subsidiaries, Pyrotite Coatings of Canada Inc., a Canadian company and Barrier Technology Corporation (&amp;#147;Barrier&amp;#148;), a US company.&amp;#160; All inter-company transactions and balances have been eliminated.&lt;/p&gt;</us-gaap:ConsolidationPolicyTextBlock>
	<us-gaap:CashAndCashEquivalentsPolicyTextBlock contextRef='D140701_150630'>&lt;!--egx--&gt;&lt;p style=&apos;margin:0pt;margin-bottom:.0001pt&apos;&gt;b)&amp;#160;&amp;#160;&amp;#160;&amp;#160;&amp;#160;&amp;#160;&amp;#160;&amp;#160; &lt;u&gt;Cash and Cash Equivalents&lt;/u&gt;&lt;/p&gt; &lt;p style=&apos;margin:0pt;margin-bottom:.0001pt&apos;&gt;&amp;nbsp;&lt;/p&gt; &lt;p style=&apos;margin:0pt;margin-bottom:.0001pt&apos;&gt;The Company considers highly liquid investments with insignificant interest rate risk and an original maturity of three months or less on the purchase date to be cash equivalents.&lt;/p&gt;</us-gaap:CashAndCashEquivalentsPolicyTextBlock>
	<us-gaap:InventoryPolicyTextBlock contextRef='D140701_150630'>&lt;!--egx--&gt;&lt;p style=&apos;margin:0pt;margin-bottom:.0001pt&apos;&gt;c)&amp;#160;&amp;#160;&amp;#160;&amp;#160;&amp;#160;&amp;#160;&amp;#160;&amp;#160; &lt;u&gt;Inventory&lt;/u&gt;&lt;/p&gt; &lt;p style=&apos;margin:0pt;margin-bottom:.0001pt&apos;&gt;&amp;nbsp;&lt;/p&gt; &lt;p style=&apos;margin:0pt;margin-bottom:.0001pt&apos;&gt;Inventory is valued by management at the lower of cost on a FIFO (first-in, first-out) and net realizable value. Net realizable value is the estimated selling price less any additional cost of sale. &amp;#160;&amp;#160;In addition, items such as abnormal amounts of idle facility expense, freight, handling and waste material are recognized as current period charges rather than inventory value.&lt;/p&gt;</us-gaap:InventoryPolicyTextBlock>
	<us-gaap:PropertyPlantAndEquipmentPolicyTextBlock contextRef='D140701_150630'>&lt;!--egx--&gt;&lt;p style=&apos;margin:0pt;margin-bottom:.0001pt&apos;&gt;d)&amp;#160;&amp;#160;&amp;#160;&amp;#160;&amp;#160;&amp;#160;&amp;#160;&amp;#160; &lt;u&gt;Plant and Equipment, Trademark and Technology Rights and Depreciation&lt;/u&gt;&lt;/p&gt; &lt;p style=&apos;margin:0pt;margin-bottom:.0001pt&apos;&gt;&amp;nbsp;&lt;/p&gt; &lt;p style=&apos;margin:0pt;margin-bottom:.0001pt&apos;&gt;Plant and equipment and trademark and technology rights are recorded at cost.&amp;#160; Depreciation is provided as follows:&lt;/p&gt; &lt;p style=&apos;margin:0pt;margin-bottom:.0001pt&apos;&gt;&amp;nbsp;&lt;/p&gt; &lt;p style=&apos;margin:0pt;margin-bottom:.0001pt&apos;&gt;&amp;nbsp;&lt;/p&gt; &lt;table border=&quot;0&quot; cellspacing=&quot;0&quot; cellpadding=&quot;0&quot; style=&apos;border-collapse:collapse&apos;&gt; &lt;tr align=&quot;left&quot;&gt; &lt;td width=&quot;246&quot; valign=&quot;top&quot; style=&apos;width:184.5pt;padding:0pt 5.4pt 0pt 5.4pt&apos;&gt; &lt;p style=&apos;margin:0pt;margin-bottom:.0001pt&apos;&gt;Manufacturing equipment&lt;/p&gt; &lt;/td&gt; &lt;td width=&quot;345&quot; valign=&quot;top&quot; style=&apos;width:258.9pt;padding:0pt 5.4pt 0pt 5.4pt&apos;&gt; &lt;p style=&apos;margin:0pt;margin-bottom:.0001pt&apos;&gt;straight line over estimated useful lives ranging from 5 years to 30 years.&lt;/p&gt; &lt;/td&gt; &lt;/tr&gt; &lt;tr align=&quot;left&quot;&gt; &lt;td width=&quot;246&quot; valign=&quot;top&quot; style=&apos;width:184.5pt;padding:0pt 5.4pt 0pt 5.4pt&apos;&gt; &lt;p style=&apos;margin:0pt;margin-bottom:.0001pt&apos;&gt;Equipment and furniture&lt;/p&gt; &lt;/td&gt; &lt;/tr&gt; &lt;tr align=&quot;left&quot;&gt; &lt;td width=&quot;246&quot; valign=&quot;top&quot; style=&apos;width:184.5pt;padding:0pt 5.4pt 0pt 5.4pt&apos;&gt; &lt;p style=&apos;margin:0pt;margin-bottom:.0001pt&apos;&gt;Computer equipment&lt;/p&gt; &lt;/td&gt; &lt;td width=&quot;345&quot; valign=&quot;top&quot; style=&apos;width:258.9pt;padding:0pt 5.4pt 0pt 5.4pt&apos;&gt; &lt;p style=&apos;margin:0pt;margin-bottom:.0001pt&apos;&gt;30% - declining balance&lt;/p&gt; &lt;/td&gt; &lt;/tr&gt; &lt;tr align=&quot;left&quot;&gt; &lt;td width=&quot;246&quot; valign=&quot;top&quot; style=&apos;width:184.5pt;padding:0pt 5.4pt 0pt 5.4pt&apos;&gt; &lt;p style=&apos;margin:0pt;margin-bottom:.0001pt&apos;&gt;Railway spur&lt;/p&gt; &lt;/td&gt; &lt;td width=&quot;345&quot; valign=&quot;top&quot; style=&apos;width:258.9pt;padding:0pt 5.4pt 0pt 5.4pt&apos;&gt; &lt;p style=&apos;margin:0pt;margin-bottom:.0001pt&apos;&gt;4% - declining balance&lt;/p&gt; &lt;/td&gt; &lt;/tr&gt; &lt;tr align=&quot;left&quot;&gt; &lt;td width=&quot;246&quot; valign=&quot;top&quot; style=&apos;width:184.5pt;padding:0pt 5.4pt 0pt 5.4pt&apos;&gt; &lt;p style=&apos;margin:0pt;margin-bottom:.0001pt&apos;&gt;Equipment under capital lease&lt;/p&gt; &lt;/td&gt; &lt;td width=&quot;345&quot; valign=&quot;top&quot; style=&apos;width:258.9pt;padding:0pt 5.4pt 0pt 5.4pt&apos;&gt; &lt;p style=&apos;margin:0pt;margin-bottom:.0001pt&apos;&gt;20% - declining balance&lt;/p&gt; &lt;/td&gt; &lt;/tr&gt; &lt;tr align=&quot;left&quot;&gt; &lt;td width=&quot;246&quot; valign=&quot;top&quot; style=&apos;width:184.5pt;padding:0pt 5.4pt 0pt 5.4pt&apos;&gt; &lt;p style=&apos;margin:0pt;margin-bottom:.0001pt&apos;&gt;Building under capital lease&lt;/p&gt; &lt;/td&gt; &lt;td width=&quot;345&quot; valign=&quot;top&quot; style=&apos;width:258.9pt;padding:0pt 5.4pt 0pt 5.4pt&apos;&gt; &lt;p style=&apos;margin:0pt;margin-bottom:.0001pt&apos;&gt;straight line over 20 years&lt;/p&gt; &lt;/td&gt; &lt;/tr&gt; &lt;tr align=&quot;left&quot;&gt; &lt;td width=&quot;246&quot; valign=&quot;top&quot; style=&apos;width:184.5pt;padding:0pt 5.4pt 0pt 5.4pt&apos;&gt; &lt;p style=&apos;margin:0pt;margin-bottom:.0001pt&apos;&gt;Patent, trademark and technology rights&lt;/p&gt; &lt;/td&gt; &lt;td width=&quot;345&quot; valign=&quot;top&quot; style=&apos;width:258.9pt;padding:0pt 5.4pt 0pt 5.4pt&apos;&gt; &lt;p style=&apos;margin:0pt;margin-bottom:.0001pt&apos;&gt;straight line over 8 years&lt;/p&gt; &lt;/td&gt; &lt;/tr&gt; &lt;/table&gt; &lt;p style=&apos;margin:0pt;margin-bottom:.0001pt&apos;&gt;&amp;nbsp;&lt;/p&gt; &lt;p style=&apos;margin:0pt;margin-bottom:.0001pt&apos;&gt;&amp;nbsp;&lt;/p&gt; &lt;p style=&apos;margin:0pt;margin-bottom:.0001pt&apos;&gt;Leasehold improvements are depreciated over the shorter of the lease term or the estimated useful economic life.&lt;/p&gt;</us-gaap:PropertyPlantAndEquipmentPolicyTextBlock>	<us-gaap:ImpairmentOrDisposalOfLongLivedAssetsPolicyTextBlock contextRef='D140701_150630'>&lt;!--egx--&gt;&lt;p style=&apos;margin:0pt;margin-bottom:.0001pt&apos;&gt;e)&amp;#160;&amp;#160;&amp;#160;&amp;#160;&amp;#160;&amp;#160;&amp;#160;&amp;#160; &lt;u&gt;Impairment of Long-Lived Assets&lt;/u&gt;&lt;/p&gt; &lt;p style=&apos;margin:0pt;margin-bottom:.0001pt&apos;&gt;&amp;nbsp;&lt;/p&gt; &lt;p style=&apos;margin:0pt;margin-bottom:.0001pt&apos;&gt;The Company reviews the recoverability of its long-lived assets whenever events or changes in circumstances indicate that the carrying amount of such assets may not be recoverable. The estimated future cash flows are based upon, among other things, assumptions about future operating performance, and may differ from actual cash flows. Long-lived assets evaluated for impairment are grouped with other assets to the lowest level for which identifiable cash flows are largely independent of the cash flows of other groups of assets and liabilities. If the sum of the projected undiscounted cash flows (excluding interest) is less than the carrying value of the assets, the assets will be written down to the estimated fair value in the period in which the determination is made.&lt;/p&gt;</us-gaap:ImpairmentOrDisposalOfLongLivedAssetsPolicyTextBlock>	<us-gaap:LeasePolicyTextBlock contextRef='D140701_150630'>&lt;!--egx--&gt;&lt;p style=&apos;margin:0pt;margin-bottom:.0001pt&apos;&gt;f)&amp;#160;&amp;#160;&amp;#160;&amp;#160;&amp;#160;&amp;#160;&amp;#160;&amp;#160;&amp;#160; &lt;u&gt;Leases&lt;/u&gt;&lt;/p&gt; &lt;p style=&apos;margin:0pt;margin-bottom:.0001pt&apos;&gt;&amp;nbsp;&lt;/p&gt; &lt;p style=&apos;margin:0pt;margin-bottom:.0001pt&apos;&gt;Leases are classified as capital or operating leases.&amp;#160; A lease that transfers substantially all benefits and risks incidental to the ownership of property is classified as a capital lease.&amp;#160; At the inception of a capital lease, an asset and an obligation are recorded at an amount equal to the lesser of the present value of the minimum lease payments and the property&amp;#146;s fair value at the beginning of the lease.&amp;#160; All other leases are accounted for as operating leases wherein rental payments are expensed as incurred.&lt;/p&gt;</us-gaap:LeasePolicyTextBlock>
	<us-gaap:ForeignCurrencyTransactionsAndTranslationsPolicyTextBlock contextRef='D140701_150630'>&lt;!--egx--&gt;&lt;p style=&apos;margin:0pt;margin-bottom:.0001pt&apos;&gt;g)&amp;#160;&amp;#160;&amp;#160;&amp;#160;&amp;#160;&amp;#160;&amp;#160;&amp;#160; &lt;u&gt;Foreign Currency Translation&lt;/u&gt;&lt;/p&gt; &lt;p style=&apos;margin:0pt;margin-bottom:.0001pt&apos;&gt;&amp;nbsp;&lt;/p&gt; &lt;p style=&apos;margin:0pt;margin-bottom:.0001pt&apos;&gt;The functional currency for the Company&amp;#146;s operations is the U.S. dollar. Monetary assets and liabilities denominated in Canadian dollars are translated into U.S. dollars at the exchange rate prevailing at the end of the year.&amp;#160; Non-monetary assets and liabilities are translated at the exchange rate prevailing at the respective transaction dates while revenues and expenses are translated at the average exchange rate during the year.&amp;#160; Exchange gains and losses are recognized in the statement of operations.&lt;/p&gt;</us-gaap:ForeignCurrencyTransactionsAndTranslationsPolicyTextBlock>	<us-gaap:ResearchAndDevelopmentExpensePolicy contextRef='D140701_150630'>&lt;!--egx--&gt;&lt;p style=&apos;margin:0pt;margin-bottom:.0001pt&apos;&gt;h)&amp;#160;&amp;#160;&amp;#160;&amp;#160;&amp;#160;&amp;#160;&amp;#160;&amp;#160; &lt;u&gt;Research and Development Costs&lt;/u&gt;&lt;/p&gt; &lt;p style=&apos;margin:0pt;margin-bottom:.0001pt&apos;&gt;&amp;nbsp;&lt;/p&gt; &lt;p style=&apos;margin:0pt;margin-bottom:.0001pt&apos;&gt;Research and development costs are expensed in the year in which they are incurred.&lt;/p&gt;</us-gaap:ResearchAndDevelopmentExpensePolicy>
	<us-gaap:EarningsPerSharePolicyTextBlock contextRef='D140701_150630'>&lt;!--egx--&gt;&lt;p style=&apos;margin:0pt;margin-bottom:.0001pt&apos;&gt;i)&amp;#160;&amp;#160;&amp;#160;&amp;#160;&amp;#160;&amp;#160;&amp;#160;&amp;#160;&amp;#160; &lt;u&gt;Basic and Diluted Income (Loss) per Share&lt;/u&gt;&lt;/p&gt; &lt;p style=&apos;margin:0pt;margin-bottom:.0001pt&apos;&gt;&amp;nbsp;&lt;/p&gt; &lt;p style=&apos;margin:0pt;margin-bottom:.0001pt&apos;&gt;Earnings or loss per share (&amp;#147;EPS&amp;#148;) is computed by dividing net income (loss) available to common stockholders by the weighted average number of common shares outstanding for the period. Diluted EPS is computed by dividing net income (loss) by the weighted-average of all potentially dilutive shares of common stock that were outstanding during the periods presented. The number of shares potentially issuable at June 30, 2015 upon the exercise or conversion of share purchase warrants, share purchase options and conversion of convertible debentures totaled 5,877,500.&amp;#160; The number of shares potentially issuable at June 30, 2014 upon exercise or conversion of share purchase warrants and share purchase options and the conversion of convertible debentures totaled 9,130,000. &lt;/p&gt; &lt;p style=&apos;margin:0pt;margin-bottom:.0001pt&apos;&gt;The treasury stock method is used in calculating diluted EPS for potentially dilutive stock options and share purchase warrants, which assumes that any proceeds received from the exercise of in-the-money stock options and share purchase warrants, would be used to purchase common shares at the average market price for the period. &lt;/p&gt; &lt;p style=&apos;margin:0pt;margin-bottom:.0001pt&apos;&gt;EPS for convertible debt is calculated under the &amp;#147;if-converted&amp;#148; method. Under the if converted method, EPS is calculated as the more dilutive of EPS (i) including all interest (both cash interest and non-cash discount amortization) and excluding all shares underlying the Notes or; (ii) excluding all interest and costs directly related to the convertible debt (both cash interest and non-cash discount amortization) and including all shares underlying the convertible debt.&lt;/p&gt; &lt;p style=&apos;margin:0pt;margin-bottom:.0001pt&apos;&gt;The basic and diluted earnings per share for the years ended June 30, 2015 and 2014 were calculated as follows:&lt;/p&gt; &lt;p style=&apos;margin:0pt;margin-bottom:.0001pt&apos;&gt;&amp;nbsp;&lt;/p&gt; &lt;/td&gt; &lt;td width=&quot;147&quot; valign=&quot;bottom&quot; style=&apos;width:110.2pt;border:none;border-bottom:solid windowtext 1.0pt;padding:0pt 5.4pt 0pt 5.4pt&apos;&gt; &lt;p align=&quot;right&quot; &lt;p align=&quot;right&quot; style=&apos;margin:0pt;margin-bottom:.0001pt;text-align:right&apos;&gt;&amp;nbsp;&lt;/p&gt; &lt;/td&gt; &lt;td width=&quot;147&quot; valign=&quot;top&quot; style=&apos;width:110.2pt;width:87.3pt !msorm;border:none;padding:0pt 5.4pt 0pt 5.4pt;border:none !msorm;padding:0pt 5.4pt 0pt 5.4pt !msorm&apos;&gt; &lt;p align=&quot;right&quot; style=&apos;margin:0pt;margin-bottom:.0001pt;text-align:right&apos;&gt;&amp;nbsp;&lt;/p&gt; &lt;/td&gt; &lt;/tr&gt; &lt;tr align=&quot;left&quot;&gt; &lt;td width=&quot;328&quot; &lt;/td&gt; &lt;td width=&quot;147&quot; valign=&quot;top&quot; style=&apos;width:110.2pt;width:103.5pt !msorm;border:none;border-bottom:double windowtext 1.5pt;padding:0pt 5.4pt 0pt 5.4pt;border:none !msorm;border-bottom:double windowtext 1.5pt !msorm;padding:0pt 5.4pt 0pt 5.4pt !msorm&apos;&gt;
